ETYMOLOGY: From Latin Aprīlis, probably related to aperīre ('to open'), referring to the opening of flowers and the start of spring. It might also be derived from the Etruscan name Apru, linked to the Greek goddess Aphrodite.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The fourth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, coming after March and before May, having 30 days.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 公历一年中的第四个月，位于三月之后，五月之前，有30天。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The cherry blossoms usually peak in mid-April.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 樱花通常在四月中旬盛开。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The springtime or early period of life, signifying youth, freshness, or innocence.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 青春时期；人生的早期；生机勃勃的阶段。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He recalled the sweet memories of his April, before the struggles began.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他回忆起他青春时期的美好时光，在那段时期，磨难尚未开始。
